articles.title: This AI spots dangerous blood cells doctors often miss
articles.description: A generative AI system can now analyze blood cells with greater accuracy and confidence than human experts, detecting subtle signs of diseases like leukemia. It not only spots rare abnormalities but also recognizes its own uncertainty, making it a powerful support tool for clinicians.

articles.title: Scientists discover how the uterus knows when to push during childbirth
articles.description: Childbirth depends not just on hormones, but on the uterus’s ability to sense physical force. Scientists found that pressure and stretch sensors in uterine muscles and surrounding nerves work together to trigger coordinated contractions. articles.description: Scientists have pulled back the curtain on one of the most extreme solar regions seen in decades, tracking it almost nonstop for three months as it unleashed powerful space weather. articles.title: This strange form of water may power giant planets’ magnetic fields
articles.description: At extreme pressures and temperatures, water becomes superionic — a solid that behaves partly like a liquid and conducts electricity.
